data.title: The 'Grey's Anatomy' cast when they first and last appeared on the show
data.meta_description: The ABC medical drama is heading into its 17th season, but only a handful of the original cast is still part of the show.
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

There are 17 seasons of ABC's "Grey's Anatomy," but most characters from episode one are gone.

Meredith Grey (Ellen Pompeo) experienced a lot since she first walked into Seattle Grace Hospital.

Alex Karev (Justin Chambers) and Cristina Yang (Sandra Oh) are no longer on the show.

Warning: Spoilers for all 17 seasons of "Grey's Anatomy" ahead.

Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.

Advertisement

Meredith Grey went from an inexperienced intern to the head of general surgery with many bumps along the way.

First seen: Season one, episode one. Her first scene was waking up after a one-night stand with Derek, unaware that he was actually her boss.

Last seen: Still a series regular on season 17, Meredith has been dealing with a serious case of the coronavirus and has spent most of her time in a coma.

Advertisement

Cristina Yang left Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital to work in Switzerland.

First seen: Season one, episode one. She started as a dedicated intern, determined to outshine her peers.

Last seen: Season 10, episode 24. On the season-10 finale, she left Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital for the Klausman Institute for Medical Research in Zurich, Switzerland. Meredith and Cristina danced it out one last time before she departed.

Bonus: A woman was seen holding Meredith's hand during Derek's funeral in season 11. Although it was hard to tell, actor Kevin McKidd (who plays Owen Hunt) told TVLine it was Cristina.

Advertisement

Izzie Stevens left Seattle and Alex Karev, behind after being fired from the hospital.

First seen: Season one, episode one. After growing up in a trailer park with her mother, Izzie Stevens went on to pay for medical school by modeling. She entered "Grey's Anatomy" as an intern alongside Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, Alex Karev, and George O'Malley.

Last seen: Season six, episode 12. Izzie was fired by Richard Webber during the merger between Seattle Grace and Mercy West. She left her life in Seattle behind after being told to leave by Alex Karev.

Bonus: We later hear an update about Izzie's life on season 16 where we learn she'd used Karev's sperm to have twins.

Advertisement

Alex Karev started as a cocky intern and grew a lot before leaving Seattle during season 16.

First seen: Season one, episode one. Karev was one of the original interns and a well-known flirt.

Last seen: Season 16, episode eight. After the actor who plays Karev, Justin Chambers, announced he was leaving the show in 2019, Karev was written off with a voiceover. His last true physical appearance is on episode eight of season 16, but viewers hear his voice later in the season.

By the end of the season, Karev has left Jo and Seattle to go be a father for his twins that he learned his ex, Izzie, had with his sperm five years earlier.

Advertisement

George O'Malley died a tragic death.

First seen: Season one, episode one. He appeared as a kind-hearted intern who eventually performed his first solo surgery in an elevator.

Last seen: Season five, episode 24. George died after jumping in front of a bus to save a woman's life. Because he was so disfigured from the injuries he sustained, no one knew George was the patient until he traced his nickname, "007," on Meredith's hand.

Bonus: He made a brief appearance in a Dia de los Muertos-inspired episode during season 15. He also appeared during season 17 as part of Meredith Grey's coma subplot.

Advertisement

Miranda Bailey went from surgical resident to chief of surgery at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital.

First seen: Season one, episode one. Miranda Bailey was responsible for taking the new class of interns under her wing.

Last seen: Bailey remains a series regular and spent much of the season trying to keep the hospital in shape.

Advertisement

Richard Webber has gone from being chief of surgery to being fired from the hospital to being a patient.

First seen: Season one, episode one. Richard Webber was the chief of surgery at Seattle Grace Hospital.

Last seen: Webber remains a series regular and spent much of season 17 caring for patients and trying to keep the hospital and its staff together.

Advertisement

Preston Burke made a guest appearance years after his original departure.

First seen: Season one, episode one. He was the head of cardio when Meredith Grey and the rest of her intern class started at Seattle Grace Hospital.

Last seen: Season 10, episode 22. Although actor Isaiah Washington left the show at the end of season three, his character made another appearance on season 10 when he asked Cristina to take over his research hospital in Switzerland.

Advertisement

Derek Shepherd died after a tragic car accident.

First seen: Season one, episode one. Derek had a one-night stand with Meredith after meeting her in Joe's Bar. It was later revealed that he would be her boss.

Last seen: Season 11, episode 25. Derek was hit by a truck after stopping to help car-crash victims on his way to the airport. His final scene is a flashback of him leaving Meredith a sweet voicemail.

Bonus: Derek made a brief appearance as Meredith walked down the hospital halls during a Dia de los Muertos-inspired episode on season 15. He also made appearances throughout season 17 as part of Meredith's coma subplot.

Advertisement

Addison Montgomery (formerly Montgomery-Shepherd) left for her own spin-off called "Private Practice."

First seen: Season one, episode nine. She visited Seattle Grace where it was revealed that she was still married to Derek.

Last seen: Season eight, episode 13. Addison appeared in Meredith's dream of an alternate reality.

Advertisement

Mark Sloan was one of the victims of the devastating plane crash.

First seen: Season two, episode 18. Mark Sloan visited Seattle Grace Hospital in an effort to bring Addison back to New York. He eventually stayed in Seattle and became the head of plastic surgery.

Last seen: Season nine, episode two. Mark was one of the doctors killed in a plane crash, along with the love of his life, Lexie Grey.

Bonus: He also appeared. with Lexie during season 17 as part of Meredith Grey's coma subplot.

Advertisement

Callie Torres moved on to New York.

First seen: Season two, episode 19. Callie Torres was an orthopedic-surgery resident who was first introduced after helping George with a dislocated shoulder.

Last seen: Season 12, episode 24. Arizona Robbins allowed Torres to take their daughter, Sofia, and move to New York City.

Advertisement

Ellis Grey made a guest appearance during the show's 500th episode.

First seen: Season one, episode one. Ellis Grey was introduced as Meredith's mother and a Harper Avery Award-winning doctor. Ellis was diagnosed with Alzheimer's and was living in a nursing home.

Last seen: Season 14, episode seven. Meredith had a vision of her mother clapping after she wins her own Harper Avery Award.

Advertisement

Adele Webber died with her husband, Richard, by her side.

First seen: Season two, episode two. Adele Webber was the first wife of Richard, who was the current chief of surgery at Seattle Grace Hosptial.

Last seen: Season nine, episode 10. After a battle with Alzheimer's, she died of a heart attack.

Advertisement

Although he died, Denny Duquette appeared to other characters in their dreams or visions.

First seen: Season two, episode 13. Denny Duquette was a long-time patient of Preston's. He flirted with Izzie after showing up to Seattle Grace Hospital for a potential heart transplant.

Last seen: Season five, episode 23. Denny died in the final episode of the second season. However, his last appearance on the show was when he appeared to Izzie in a dream.

Advertisement

Erica Hahn left abruptly after a messy split with Callie.

First seen: Season two, episode 25. Erica Hahn was fighting for a donor heart for a patient at the same time Preston showed up to receive the organ for Denny.

Last seen: Season five, episode seven. She decided that working alongside her ex-girlfriend, Callie, was too much for her.

Advertisement

Lexie Grey suffered a terrible death in the plane crash.

First seen: Season three, episode 24. In her earliest appearance, Lexie Grey hit on Derek in Joe's Bar, unaware that he was her half-sister Meredith's great love. She quickly befriended George during his last year as an intern.

Last seen: Season eight, episode 24. Lexie died after suffering traumatic injuries from a plane crash. She died holding Mark's hand as he talked about their future.

Bonus: She also appeared with Mark during season 17 as part of Meredith Grey's coma subplot.

Advertisement

Owen Hunt thought he finally had the family he's always wanted.

First seen: Season five, episode one. Owen Hunt was an Army trauma surgeon before he joined the staff at Seattle Grace Hospital. Viewers were first introduced to his character when he performed an emergency tracheotomy with a pen.

Last seen: Owen spent much of the season dealing with coronavirus patients and the fact that his fiancé, Teddy Altman, was cheating on him.

Advertisement

Arizona Robbins left Seattle behind to be with her daughter in New York.

First seen: Season five, episode 11. Arizona Robbins started off as a surgical fellow working for Seattle Grace's pediatric-surgery department. She was promoted to the head of the department after former head Jordan Kenley died of a heart attack.

Last seen: Season 14, episode 24. Following a number of failed romances, she left Seattle and moved to New York to make her daughter Sofia happy.

Advertisement

Teddy Altman has found herself in a tricky situation.

First seen: Season six, episode nine. Teddy worked closely with Owen during their time in the Army. He convinced her to come to Seattle, where she became the new attending cardiothoracic surgeon.

Last seen: Teddy returned for season 17 and is dealing with the aftermath of cheating on Owen right before what would be their wedding. She also dealt with a lot of PTSD pegged to her past and DeLuca's death and began going to therapy.

Advertisement

April Kepner found herself caught up in a difficult love triangle before leaving Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital to help the underprivileged in need of medical care.

First seen: Season six, episode five. April Kepner was among the new group of interns who were welcomed to Seattle Grace when the hospital merged with Mercy West.

Last seen: Season 14, episode 24. She found herself caught up in a love triangle between Jackson Avery and paramedic Matthew Taylor. In the end, she married Matthew in a spur-of-the-moment ceremony.

Bonus: She also appeared during season 17 when Jackson came to visit her.

Advertisement

Stephanie Edwards left medicine behind to explore the world after suffering severe burns during a fire at the hospital.

First seen: Season nine, episode one. Stephanie Edwards started as an intern shortly after the plane crash that claimed the lives of Mark and Lexie.

Last seen: Season 13, episode 24. She suffered severe burns after a fire in the hospital. During her final appearance, she thanked Richard for teaching her but told him it was time for her to move on and see more than the inside of a hospital.

Advertisement

Jackson Avery has gone through a number of breakups.

First seen: Season six, episode five. Jackson Avery joined the staff at Seattle Grace Hospital following the merger with Mercy West.

Last seen: He is still appearing on season 17, though the actor has announced his departure from the show. His last episode is set to air on May 20.

Advertisement

Ben Warren was an attending anesthesiologist before becoming a surgeon, then a firefighter.

First seen: Season six, episode 13. Ben Warren started off as an anesthesiologist.

Last seen: The actor who plays Ben, Jason Winston George, left "Grey's Anatomy" for its spin-off "Station 19," but his character still makes appearances at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital.

Advertisement

Amelia Shepherd's difficult past has come back to haunt her throughout her time in Seattle.

First seen: Amelia Shepherd was on "Private Practice" before becoming a recurring character on "Grey's Anatomy." She first appeared on episode three of season seven after running away from her fiancé, James.

Last seen: On season 17, Amelia and Link look after their baby boy as well as Meredith's kids while dealing with their own relationship struggles.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

Maggie Pierce has found herself in a number of tricky relationships since arriving at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital.

First seen: Season 10, episode 24. Maggie Pierce was brought on as the new head of cardiothoracic surgery. It's later revealed that she's the child of Richard and Ellis.

Last seen: On season 17, Maggie has continued to reconnect with her former work colleague, Winston, and the two are engaged.

Advertisement

Andrew DeLuca has gone from being a bumbling intern to a skilled surgeon who's struggling with his mental health.

First seen: Season 11, episode 24. DeLuca came across a tunnel collapse on his way to Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital for the first day of his internship. He was mistaken for an attending after arriving in an ambulance with one of the patients.

Last seen: Season 17, episode nine. DeLuca died on season 17 after being fatally stabbed by a sex trafficker. Some of his final moments were not on "Grey's," since the plot was part of a "Station 19" crossover event.

Bonus: Later that season, he comes back to says farewell to Meredith in her dreamlike coma state.

Advertisement

Nathan Riggs got off to a shaky start when he arrived in Seattle.

First seen: Season 12, episode six. April brought Nathan Riggs to Seattle to assist with a patient after meeting him in Jordan. Owen was not happy when he discovered Riggs was at his hospital.

Last seen: Season 14, episode five. Shortly after starting a relationship with Meredith, Riggs was reunited with his long-lost love, Megan, who is also Owen's sister. The two ended up moving to Malibu with Megan's son, Farouk.

Advertisement

Tom Koracick is moving up at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital.

First seen: Season 14, episode three. Amelia brought in her former mentor, Tom Koracick, to operate on her after discovering that she has a brain tumor.

Last seen: Throughout season 17, Koracick has dealt with having the coronavirus and he is slowly returning to his career.

THEN AND NOW: The original cast of 'Grey's Anatomy'
